strategy: Replace the gradient-boosted tree model with a neural network architecture featuring 3 hidden layers (128, 64, 32 neurons) with ReLU activations, using batch normalization and dropout (0.3, 0.2, 0.1) to regularize against overfitting. Apply a time-based split with a 6-month rolling window to maintain temporal consistency. Use target encoding with smoothing (e.g., lambda = 0.1) for categorical variables and apply a Box-Cox transformation to the target variable to improve normality and variance stability. Introduce a weighted composite loss combining MSE with a median absolute error (MAE) component to better handle outliers and skew in the price distribution.

import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, RobustScaler

import warnings

# Load data

test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

numerical_columns = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
